Parse the page to look "keyword">for full-text access options soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Look "keyword">for "read online", "full text", "PDF", "keyword">or similar access options access_indicators = [ &#x27;read online', 'full text', 'download pdf', 'view pdf', &#x27;open access', 'free access', 'read book', 'view book' ] found_access_options = [] "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in access_indicators: "keyword">if indicator "keyword">in page_text: found_access_options.append(indicator) "keyword">if found_access_options: print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Found access indicators: {found_access_options}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No obvious access indicators found "keyword">in page text') # Look "keyword">for links that might provide full-text access access_links = [] # Search "keyword">for various types of access links link_selectors = [ &#x27;a[href*="pdf"]', &#x27;a[href*="read"]', &#x27;a[href*="view"]', &#x27;a[href*="download"]', &#x27;a[href*="full"]', &#x27;a[href*="text"]', &#x27;.pdf-link a', &#x27;.read-link a', &#x27;.download-link a', &#x27;.access-link a' ] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in link_selectors: "keyword">try: links = soup.select(selector) "keyword">for link "keyword">in links: href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if href: # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if href.startswith(&#x27;/'): href = urljoin(jstor_main_url, href) link_text = link.get_text().strip() "keyword">if len(link_text) > 0 "keyword">and len(link_text) < 100: # Reasonable link text length access_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link_text, &#x27;selector': selector }) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error "keyword">with selector {selector}: {str(e)}') # Remove duplicates unique_links = [] seen_urls = set() "keyword">for link "keyword">in access_links: "keyword">if link[&#x27;url'] "keyword">not "keyword">in seen_urls: seen_urls.add(link[&#x27;url']) unique_links.append(link) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(unique_links)} potential access links:') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(unique_links[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f&#x27;{i}. "{link["text"]}" -> {link["url"]}') print(f&#x27; (Found via: {link["selector"]})') # Look specifically "keyword">for chapter/section links that might contain page 11 chapter_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in unique_links: link_url = link[&#x27;url'].lower() link_text = link[&#x27;text'].lower() # Check "keyword">if this might be a chapter "keyword">or section link "keyword">if any(indicator "keyword">in link_url "keyword">or indicator "keyword">in link_text "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in [&#x27;chapter', 'section', 'pdf', 'ctv9b2xdv']): chapter_links.append(link) "keyword">if chapter_links: print(f&#x27;\n*** FOUND {len(chapter_links)} POTENTIAL CHAPTER/SECTION LINKS ***') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(chapter_links[:5], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. "{link["text"]}" -> {link["url"]}') # Try to access the first promising link "keyword">if chapter_links: print(&#x27;\n=== ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS FIRST CHAPTER/SECTION LINK ===') first_link = chapter_links[0] print(f&#x27;Trying: {first_link["text"]} -> {first_link["url"]}') "keyword">try: chapter_response = requests.get(first_link[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Chapter access status: {chapter_response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Content type: {chapter_response.headers.get("content-type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(chapter_response.content):,} bytes') "keyword">if chapter_response.status_code == 200: content_type = chapter_response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in content_type: print(&#x27;\n*** PDF CONTENT DETECTED ***') pdf_path = &#x27;workspace/responsibility_intellectuals_chapter.pdf' "keyword">with open(pdf_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as pdf_file: pdf_file.write(chapter_response.content) file_size = os.path.getsize(pdf_path) print(f&#x27;‚úì PDF saved to: {pdf_path}') print(f&#x27;File size: {file_size:,} bytes ({file_size/1024/1024:.2f} MB)') # Try to extract text "keyword">from PDF "keyword">if possible "keyword">try: print(&#x27;\nAttempting to extract text "keyword">from PDF...') "keyword">from langchain_community.document_loaders "keyword">import PyPDFLoader loader = PyPDFLoader(pdf_path) pages = loader.load_and_split() print(f&#x27;‚úì PDF loaded successfully "keyword">with {len(pages)} pages') # Look "keyword">for page 11 specifically "keyword">if len(pages) >= 11: page_11_content = pages[10].page_content # Page 11 "keyword">is index 10 print(f&#x27;\n=== PAGE 11 CONTENT FOUND ===') print(f&#x27;Page 11 length: {len(page_11_content):,} characters') print(f&#x27;\nFirst 500 characters of page 11:') print(&#x27;='*80) print(page_11_content[:500] + &#x27;...') print(&#x27;='*80) # Save page 11 content "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/page_11_content.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(page_11_content) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Page 11 content saved to workspace/page_11_content.txt') # Look "keyword">for the second-to-last paragraph paragraphs = [p.strip() "keyword">for p "keyword">in page_11_content.split(&#x27;\n\n') "keyword">if p.strip()] print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(paragraphs)} paragraphs on page 11') "keyword">if len(paragraphs) >= 2: second_to_last_para = paragraphs[-2] print(f&#x27;\n=== SECOND-TO-LAST PARAGRAPH ON PAGE 11 ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(second_to_last_para) print(&#x27;='*80) # Look "keyword">for endnote references "keyword">in this paragraph endnote_patterns = [ r&#x27;\b(\d+)\b', # Simple numbers r&#x27;\[(\d+)\]', # Numbers "keyword">in brackets r&#x27;\((\d+)\)', # Numbers "keyword">in parentheses r&#x27;\b(\d+)\.', # Numbers "keyword">with periods r&#x27;see note (\d+)', # "see note X" format r&#x27;note (\d+)', # "note X" format ] found_endnotes = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in endnote_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, second_to_last_para, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: "keyword">if match.isdigit() "keyword">and int(match) <= 100: # Reasonable endnote number found_endnotes.append(int(match)) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and sort found_endnotes = sorted(list(set(found_endnotes))) "keyword">if found_endnotes: print(f&#x27;\n*** FOUND ENDNOTE REFERENCES: {found_endnotes} ***') # Now we need to find the actual endnotes print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR ENDNOTES SECTION ===') # Combine all pages to search "keyword">for endnotes full_text = &#x27;\n\n'.join([page.page_content "keyword">for page "keyword">in pages]) # Look "keyword">for endnotes section endnotes_indicators = [ &#x27;notes', 'endnotes', 'references', 'footnotes', &#x27;bibliography', 'works cited' ] endnotes_section_found = "keyword">False "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in endnotes_indicators: pattern = rf&#x27;\b{indicator}\b' matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE)) "keyword">if matches: print(f&#x27;Found "{indicator}" section at {len(matches)} locations') endnotes_section_found = "keyword">True # Search "keyword">for specific endnote numbers "keyword">with Wikipedia citations print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS WITH NOVEMBER ACCESS DATE ===') # Look "keyword">for Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates wikipedia_patterns = [ r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]*november[^\n]*accessed[^\n]*', r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\n]*november[^\n]*', r&#x27;accessed[^\n]*november[^\n]*wikipedia[^\n]*', r&#x27;november[^\n]*\d{1,2}[^\n]*wikipedia[^\n]*', r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]*accessed[^\n]*november[^\n]*\d{1,2}[^\n]*' ] wikipedia_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wikipedia_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: citation_text = match.group(0) # Extract the day "keyword">from November date day_match = re.search(r&#x27;november\s+(\d{1,2})', citation_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if day_match: day = day_match.group(1) wikipedia_citations.append({ &#x27;citation': citation_text, &#x27;november_day': day, &#x27;position': match.start() }) "keyword">if wikipedia_citations: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ FOUND {len(wikipedia_citations)} WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS WITH NOVEMBER ACCESS DATES:') "keyword">for i, citation "keyword">in enumerate(wikipedia_citations, 1): print(f&#x27;\nCitation {i}:') print(f&#x27;November day: {citation["november_day"]}') print(f&#x27;Position "keyword">in text: {citation["position"]}') print(&#x27;Citation text:') print(&#x27;='*60) print(citation[&#x27;citation']) print(&#x27;='*60) # Save the Wikipedia citations citations_data = { &#x27;source_file': pdf_path, &#x27;page_11_paragraph_count': len(paragraphs), &#x27;second_to_last_paragraph': second_to_last_para, &#x27;endnote_references_found': found_endnotes, &#x27;wikipedia_citations': wikipedia_citations, &#x27;extraction_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/wikipedia_citations_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(citations_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Wikipedia citations analysis saved to workspace/wikipedia_citations_analysis.json') # Extract the specific day "keyword">for the answer "keyword">if len(wikipedia_citations) == 1: answer_day = wikipedia_citations[0][&#x27;november_day'] print(f&#x27;\n*** ANSWER FOUND: The Wikipedia article was accessed on November {answer_day} ***') "keyword">elif len(wikipedia_citations) > 1: print(f&#x27;\n*** MULTIPLE WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS FOUND - Need to determine which "keyword">is "keyword">from page 11 endnote ***') "keyword">for i, citation "keyword">in enumerate(wikipedia_citations, 1): print(f&#x27;Option {i}: November {citation["november_day"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates found') print(&#x27;Searching "keyword">for any Wikipedia references...') # Broader search "keyword">for Wikipedia wiki_matches = re.finditer(r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]{0,200}', full_text, re.IGNORECASE) wiki_refs = [match.group(0) "keyword">for match "keyword">in wiki_matches] "keyword">if wiki_refs: print(f&#x27;Found {len(wiki_refs)} general Wikipedia references:') "keyword">for i, ref "keyword">in enumerate(wiki_refs[:5], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {ref[:100]}...') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No endnote references found "keyword">in second-to-last paragraph') print(&#x27;Showing paragraph content "keyword">for manual inspection:') print(second_to_last_para) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† Page 11 has fewer than 2 paragraphs ({len(paragraphs)} found)') "keyword">if paragraphs: print(&#x27;Available paragraphs:') "keyword">for i, para "keyword">in enumerate(paragraphs, 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {para[:100]}...') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† PDF has only {len(pages)} pages, page 11 "keyword">not available') print(&#x27;Available pages:') "keyword">for i, page "keyword">in enumerate(pages[:5], 1): preview = page.page_content[:100].replace(&#x27;\n', ' ') print(f&#x27;Page {i}: {preview}...') "keyword">except ImportError: print(&#x27;‚ö† PyPDFLoader "keyword">not available - PDF saved but text extraction skipped') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as pdf_error: print(f&#x27;‚ùå PDF text extraction error: {str(pdf_error)}') "keyword">elif &#x27;html' "keyword">in content_type: print(&#x27;\n*** HTML CONTENT DETECTED ***') # Save HTML content "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/chapter_content.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(chapter_response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì HTML content saved to workspace/chapter_content.html') # Parse HTML "keyword">for text content chapter_soup = BeautifulSoup(chapter_response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove navigation "keyword">and non-content elements "keyword">for element "keyword">in chapter_soup([&#x27;script', 'style', 'nav', 'header', 'footer', 'aside']): element.decompose() chapter_text = chapter_soup.get_text() print(f&#x27;\nExtracted HTML text length: {len(chapter_text):,} characters') print(f&#x27;First 300 characters: {chapter_text[:300]}...') # Save extracted text "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/chapter_text_content.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(chapter_text) print(&#x27;‚úì Chapter text content saved to workspace/chapter_text_content.txt') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n*** UNKNOWN CONTENT TYPE: {content_type} ***') print(&#x27;Saving raw content "keyword">for analysis') "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/unknown_content.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(chapter_response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì Raw content saved to workspace/unknown_content.txt') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Chapter access failed "keyword">with status: {chapter_response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as chapter_error: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error accessing chapter: {str(chapter_error)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No chapter/section links found to "keyword">try') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ùå JSTOR main page access failed "keyword">with status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error accessing JSTOR: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100) print(&#x27;FULL TEXT ACCESS ATTEMPT SUMMARY') print(&#x27;='*100) print(&#x27;Objective: Access full text to find page 11, second-to-last paragraph, "keyword">and Wikipedia endnote "keyword">with November access date') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(&#x27;\n*** NEXT STEP: Analyze extracted content "keyword">for the specific Wikipedia citation ***')

"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin "keyword">import time "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== ACCESSING FULL TEXT OF "THE RESPONSIBILITY OF INTELLECTUALS" ===') print(&#x27;DOI: 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') print(&#x27;Objective: Locate page 11, find second-to-last paragraph, extract endnote "keyword">with Wikipedia citation (November access date)') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs(&#x27;workspace', exist_ok="keyword">True) # First, let's examine the existing workspace files to understand what we have print(&#x27;=== INSPECTING EXISTING WORKSPACE FILES ===') workspace_files = os.listdir(&#x27;workspace') "keyword">if workspace_files: print(f&#x27;Found {len(workspace_files)} files "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">for file "keyword">in workspace_files: file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No existing files "keyword">in workspace') # Check "keyword">if we have the final bibliographic record final_record_path = &#x27;workspace/final_bibliographic_record.json' "keyword">if os.path.exists(final_record_path): print(&#x27;\n=== INSPECTING FINAL BIBLIOGRAPHIC RECORD ===') "keyword">with open(final_record_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Available keys "keyword">in bibliographic record:') "keyword">for key "keyword">in biblio_data.keys(): print(f&#x27;- {key}: {type(biblio_data[key])}') print(f&#x27;\nKey information:') print(f&#x27;Title: {biblio_data.get("title", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27;Publisher: {biblio_data.get("publisher", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27;Year: {biblio_data.get("publication_year", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27;DOI URL: {biblio_data.get("doi_url", "Unknown")}') print(f&#x27;JSTOR URL: {biblio_data.get("jstor_url", "Unknown")}') # Check chapters/sections structure "keyword">if &#x27;chapters_sections' "keyword">in biblio_data "keyword">and biblio_data['chapters_sections']: print(f&#x27;\nBook structure: {len(biblio_data["chapters_sections"])} chapters/sections') "keyword">for i, chapter "keyword">in enumerate(biblio_data[&#x27;chapters_sections'][:3], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {chapter.get("title", "No title")}') print(f&#x27; URL: {chapter.get("url", "No URL")}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;Final bibliographic record "keyword">not found') # Now let's "keyword">try to access the full text through JSTOR print(&#x27;\n=== ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS FULL TEXT VIA JSTOR ===') # Set up headers "keyword">for web requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', &#x27;Connection': 'keep-alive', &#x27;Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Try to access the main JSTOR book page jstor_main_url = &#x27;https://www.jstor.org/stable/j.ctv9b2xdv' print(f&#x27;Accessing main JSTOR page: {jstor_main_url}') "keyword">try: response = requests.get(jstor_main_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;JSTOR main page status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Final URL: {response.url}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: # Save the main page "keyword">for analysis "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/jstor_main_page.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì JSTOR main page saved to workspace/jstor_main_page.html') # Parse the page to look "keyword">for full-text access options soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Look "keyword">for "read online", "full text", "PDF", "keyword">or similar access options access_indicators = [ &#x27;read online', 'full text', 'download pdf', 'view pdf', &#x27;open access', 'free access', 'read book', 'view book' ] found_access_options = [] "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in access_indicators: "keyword">if indicator "keyword">in page_text: found_access_options.append(indicator) "keyword">if found_access_options: print(f&#x27;\n‚úì Found access indicators: {found_access_options}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No obvious access indicators found "keyword">in page text') # Look "keyword">for links that might provide full-text access access_links = [] # Search "keyword">for various types of access links link_selectors = [ &#x27;a[href*="pdf"]', &#x27;a[href*="read"]', &#x27;a[href*="view"]', &#x27;a[href*="download"]', &#x27;a[href*="full"]', &#x27;a[href*="text"]', &#x27;.pdf-link a', &#x27;.read-link a', &#x27;.download-link a', &#x27;.access-link a' ] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in link_selectors: "keyword">try: links = soup.select(selector) "keyword">for link "keyword">in links: href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if href: # Convert relative URLs to absolute "keyword">if href.startswith(&#x27;/'): href = urljoin(jstor_main_url, href) link_text = link.get_text().strip() "keyword">if len(link_text) > 0 "keyword">and len(link_text) < 100: # Reasonable link text length access_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;text': link_text, &#x27;selector': selector }) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;Error "keyword">with selector {selector}: {str(e)}') # Remove duplicates unique_links = [] seen_urls = set() "keyword">for link "keyword">in access_links: "keyword">if link[&#x27;url'] "keyword">not "keyword">in seen_urls: seen_urls.add(link[&#x27;url']) unique_links.append(link) print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(unique_links)} potential access links:') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(unique_links[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f&#x27;{i}. "{link["text"]}" -> {link["url"]}') print(f&#x27; (Found via: {link["selector"]})') # Look specifically "keyword">for chapter/section links that might contain page 11 chapter_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in unique_links: link_url = link[&#x27;url'].lower() link_text = link[&#x27;text'].lower() # Check "keyword">if this might be a chapter "keyword">or section link "keyword">if any(indicator "keyword">in link_url "keyword">or indicator "keyword">in link_text "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in [&#x27;chapter', 'section', 'pdf', 'ctv9b2xdv']): chapter_links.append(link) "keyword">if chapter_links: print(f&#x27;\n*** FOUND {len(chapter_links)} POTENTIAL CHAPTER/SECTION LINKS ***') "keyword">for i, link "keyword">in enumerate(chapter_links[:5], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. "{link["text"]}" -> {link["url"]}') # Try to access the first promising link "keyword">if chapter_links: print(&#x27;\n=== ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS FIRST CHAPTER/SECTION LINK ===') first_link = chapter_links[0] print(f&#x27;Trying: {first_link["text"]} -> {first_link["url"]}') "keyword">try: chapter_response = requests.get(first_link[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27;Chapter access status: {chapter_response.status_code}') print(f&#x27;Content type: {chapter_response.headers.get("content-type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27;Content length: {len(chapter_response.content):,} bytes') "keyword">if chapter_response.status_code == 200: content_type = chapter_response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in content_type: print(&#x27;\n*** PDF CONTENT DETECTED ***') pdf_path = &#x27;workspace/responsibility_intellectuals_chapter.pdf' "keyword">with open(pdf_path, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as pdf_file: pdf_file.write(chapter_response.content) file_size = os.path.getsize(pdf_path) print(f&#x27;‚úì PDF saved to: {pdf_path}') print(f&#x27;File size: {file_size:,} bytes ({file_size/1024/1024:.2f} MB)') # Try to extract text "keyword">from PDF "keyword">if possible "keyword">try: print(&#x27;\nAttempting to extract text "keyword">from PDF...') "keyword">from langchain_community.document_loaders "keyword">import PyPDFLoader loader = PyPDFLoader(pdf_path) pages = loader.load_and_split() print(f&#x27;‚úì PDF loaded successfully "keyword">with {len(pages)} pages') # Look "keyword">for page 11 specifically "keyword">if len(pages) >= 11: page_11_content = pages[10].page_content # Page 11 "keyword">is index 10 print(f&#x27;\n=== PAGE 11 CONTENT FOUND ===') print(f&#x27;Page 11 length: {len(page_11_content):,} characters') print(f&#x27;\nFirst 500 characters of page 11:') print(&#x27;='*80) print(page_11_content[:500] + &#x27;...') print(&#x27;='*80) # Save page 11 content "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/page_11_content.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(page_11_content) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Page 11 content saved to workspace/page_11_content.txt') # Look "keyword">for the second-to-last paragraph paragraphs = [p.strip() "keyword">for p "keyword">in page_11_content.split(&#x27;\n\n') "keyword">if p.strip()] print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(paragraphs)} paragraphs on page 11') "keyword">if len(paragraphs) >= 2: second_to_last_para = paragraphs[-2] print(f&#x27;\n=== SECOND-TO-LAST PARAGRAPH ON PAGE 11 ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(second_to_last_para) print(&#x27;='*80) # Look "keyword">for endnote references "keyword">in this paragraph endnote_patterns = [ r&#x27;\b(\d+)\b', # Simple numbers r&#x27;\[(\d+)\]', # Numbers "keyword">in brackets r&#x27;\((\d+)\)', # Numbers "keyword">in parentheses r&#x27;\b(\d+)\.', # Numbers "keyword">with periods r&#x27;see note (\d+)', # "see note X" format r&#x27;note (\d+)', # "note X" format ] found_endnotes = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in endnote_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, second_to_last_para, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: "keyword">if match.isdigit() "keyword">and int(match) <= 100: # Reasonable endnote number found_endnotes.append(int(match)) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and sort found_endnotes = sorted(list(set(found_endnotes))) "keyword">if found_endnotes: print(f&#x27;\n*** FOUND ENDNOTE REFERENCES: {found_endnotes} ***') # Now we need to find the actual endnotes print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR ENDNOTES SECTION ===') # Combine all pages to search "keyword">for endnotes full_text = &#x27;\n\n'.join([page.page_content "keyword">for page "keyword">in pages]) # Look "keyword">for endnotes section endnotes_indicators = [ &#x27;notes', 'endnotes', 'references', 'footnotes', &#x27;bibliography', 'works cited' ] endnotes_section_found = "keyword">False "keyword">for indicator "keyword">in endnotes_indicators: pattern = rf&#x27;\b{indicator}\b' matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE)) "keyword">if matches: print(f&#x27;Found "{indicator}" section at {len(matches)} locations') endnotes_section_found = "keyword">True # Search "keyword">for specific endnote numbers "keyword">with Wikipedia citations print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS WITH NOVEMBER ACCESS DATE ===') # Look "keyword">for Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates wikipedia_patterns = [ r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]*november[^\n]*accessed[^\n]*', r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\n]*november[^\n]*', r&#x27;accessed[^\n]*november[^\n]*wikipedia[^\n]*', r&#x27;november[^\n]*\d{1,2}[^\n]*wikipedia[^\n]*', r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]*accessed[^\n]*november[^\n]*\d{1,2}[^\n]*' ] wikipedia_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wikipedia_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: citation_text = match.group(0) # Extract the day "keyword">from November date day_match = re.search(r&#x27;november\s+(\d{1,2})', citation_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if day_match: day = day_match.group(1) wikipedia_citations.append({ &#x27;citation': citation_text, &#x27;november_day': day, &#x27;position': match.start() }) "keyword">if wikipedia_citations: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ FOUND {len(wikipedia_citations)} WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS WITH NOVEMBER ACCESS DATES:') "keyword">for i, citation "keyword">in enumerate(wikipedia_citations, 1): print(f&#x27;\nCitation {i}:') print(f&#x27;November day: {citation["november_day"]}') print(f&#x27;Position "keyword">in text: {citation["position"]}') print(&#x27;Citation text:') print(&#x27;='*60) print(citation[&#x27;citation']) print(&#x27;='*60) # Save the Wikipedia citations citations_data = { &#x27;source_file': pdf_path, &#x27;page_11_paragraph_count': len(paragraphs), &#x27;second_to_last_paragraph': second_to_last_para, &#x27;endnote_references_found': found_endnotes, &#x27;wikipedia_citations': wikipedia_citations, &#x27;extraction_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/wikipedia_citations_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(citations_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Wikipedia citations analysis saved to workspace/wikipedia_citations_analysis.json') # Extract the specific day "keyword">for the answer "keyword">if len(wikipedia_citations) == 1: answer_day = wikipedia_citations[0][&#x27;november_day'] print(f&#x27;\n*** ANSWER FOUND: The Wikipedia article was accessed on November {answer_day} ***') "keyword">elif len(wikipedia_citations) > 1: print(f&#x27;\n*** MULTIPLE WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS FOUND - Need to determine which "keyword">is "keyword">from page 11 endnote ***') "keyword">for i, citation "keyword">in enumerate(wikipedia_citations, 1): print(f&#x27;Option {i}: November {citation["november_day"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates found') print(&#x27;Searching "keyword">for any Wikipedia references...') # Broader search "keyword">for Wikipedia wiki_matches = re.finditer(r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]{0,200}', full_text, re.IGNORECASE) wiki_refs = [match.group(0) "keyword">for match "keyword">in wiki_matches] "keyword">if wiki_refs: print(f&#x27;Found {len(wiki_refs)} general Wikipedia references:') "keyword">for i, ref "keyword">in enumerate(wiki_refs[:5], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {ref[:100]}...') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No endnote references found "keyword">in second-to-last paragraph') print(&#x27;Showing paragraph content "keyword">for manual inspection:') print(second_to_last_para) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† Page 11 has fewer than 2 paragraphs ({len(paragraphs)} found)') "keyword">if paragraphs: print(&#x27;Available paragraphs:') "keyword">for i, para "keyword">in enumerate(paragraphs, 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {para[:100]}...') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† PDF has only {len(pages)} pages, page 11 "keyword">not available') print(&#x27;Available pages:') "keyword">for i, page "keyword">in enumerate(pages[:5], 1): preview = page.page_content[:100].replace(&#x27;\n', ' ') print(f&#x27;Page {i}: {preview}...') "keyword">except ImportError: print(&#x27;‚ö† PyPDFLoader "keyword">not available - PDF saved but text extraction skipped') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as pdf_error: print(f&#x27;‚ùå PDF text extraction error: {str(pdf_error)}') "keyword">elif &#x27;html' "keyword">in content_type: print(&#x27;\n*** HTML CONTENT DETECTED ***') # Save HTML content "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/chapter_content.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(chapter_response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì HTML content saved to workspace/chapter_content.html') # Parse HTML "keyword">for text content chapter_soup = BeautifulSoup(chapter_response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove navigation "keyword">and non-content elements "keyword">for element "keyword">in chapter_soup([&#x27;script', 'style', 'nav', 'header', 'footer', 'aside']): element.decompose() chapter_text = chapter_soup.get_text() print(f&#x27;\nExtracted HTML text length: {len(chapter_text):,} characters') print(f&#x27;First 300 characters: {chapter_text[:300]}...') # Save extracted text "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/chapter_text_content.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(chapter_text) print(&#x27;‚úì Chapter text content saved to workspace/chapter_text_content.txt') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n*** UNKNOWN CONTENT TYPE: {content_type} ***') print(&#x27;Saving raw content "keyword">for analysis') "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/unknown_content.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(chapter_response.text) print(&#x27;‚úì Raw content saved to workspace/unknown_content.txt') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Chapter access failed "keyword">with status: {chapter_response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as chapter_error: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error accessing chapter: {str(chapter_error)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No chapter/section links found to "keyword">try') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;‚ùå JSTOR main page access failed "keyword">with status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error accessing JSTOR: {str(e)}') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100) print(&#x27;FULL TEXT ACCESS ATTEMPT SUMMARY') print(&#x27;='*100) print(&#x27;Objective: Access full text to find page 11, second-to-last paragraph, "keyword">and Wikipedia endnote "keyword">with November access date') print(&#x27;\nFiles created "keyword">in workspace:') "keyword">if os.path.exists(&#x27;workspace'): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;workspace'): file_path = os.path.join(&#x27;workspace', file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f&#x27;- {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print(&#x27;\n*** NEXT STEP: Analyze extracted content "keyword">for the specific Wikipedia citation ***')
üìÑ Output

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin "keyword">import time "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== ALTERNATIVE ACCESS APPROACH: TRYING SPECIFIC CHAPTER PDF LINKS ===') print(&#x27;DOI: 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') print(&#x27;Objective: Access individual chapter PDFs to locate page 11 "keyword">and Wikipedia endnote') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # First, inspect the final bibliographic record to get chapter URLs final_record_path = &#x27;workspace/final_bibliographic_record.json' "keyword">if os.path.exists(final_record_path): print(&#x27;=== INSPECTING BIBLIOGRAPHIC RECORD FOR CHAPTER URLS ===') "keyword">with open(final_record_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Checking chapters_sections structure...') "keyword">if &#x27;chapters_sections' "keyword">in biblio_data: chapters = biblio_data[&#x27;chapters_sections'] print(f&#x27;Found {len(chapters)} chapters/sections') # Extract PDF links specifically pdf_links = [] "keyword">for i, chapter "keyword">in enumerate(chapters, 1): chapter_url = chapter.get(&#x27;url', '') chapter_title = chapter.get(&#x27;title', f'Chapter {i}') print(f&#x27;{i}. {chapter_title}') print(f&#x27; URL: {chapter_url}') "keyword">if &#x27;.pdf' "keyword">in chapter_url.lower(): pdf_links.append({ &#x27;title': chapter_title, &#x27;url': chapter_url, &#x27;index': i }) print(&#x27; *** PDF LINK DETECTED ***') print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(pdf_links)} direct PDF links:') "keyword">for pdf_link "keyword">in pdf_links: print(f&#x27;- {pdf_link["title"]} -> {pdf_link["url"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;Final bibliographic record "keyword">not found') exit() # Set up headers "keyword">for requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'application/pdf,text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Referer': 'https://www.jstor.org/' } # Try accessing each PDF link successful_pdfs = [] print(&#x27;\n=== ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS INDIVIDUAL CHAPTER PDFS ===') "keyword">for i, pdf_link "keyword">in enumerate(pdf_links, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Trying: {pdf_link["title"]}') print(f&#x27; URL: {pdf_link["url"]}') "keyword">try: response = requests.get(pdf_link[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27; Content-Type: {response.headers.get("content-type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Content-Length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: content_type = response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or len(response.content) > 10000: # Likely PDF "keyword">if large print(&#x27; *** SUCCESS: PDF CONTENT RETRIEVED ***') # Save the PDF pdf_filename = f&#x27;workspace/chapter_{i}_{pdf_link["index"]}.pdf' "keyword">with open(pdf_filename, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as pdf_file: pdf_file.write(response.content) file_size = os.path.getsize(pdf_filename) print(f&#x27; ‚úì PDF saved to: {pdf_filename}') print(f&#x27; File size: {file_size:,} bytes ({file_size/1024/1024:.2f} MB)') successful_pdfs.append({ &#x27;title': pdf_link['title'], &#x27;filename': pdf_filename, &#x27;size': file_size, &#x27;original_url': pdf_link['url'] }) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ö† Content does "keyword">not appear to be PDF: {content_type}') # Save "keyword">as HTML "keyword">for inspection html_filename = f&#x27;workspace/chapter_{i}_response.html' "keyword">with open(html_filename, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as html_file: html_file.write(response.text) print(f&#x27; Saved response "keyword">as HTML: {html_filename}') "keyword">elif response.status_code == 403: print(&#x27; ‚ùå Access forbidden (403) - authentication may be required') "keyword">elif response.status_code == 404: print(&#x27; ‚ùå Not found (404) - URL may be invalid') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Request failed "keyword">with status {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Error accessing PDF: {str(e)}') time.sleep(1) # Brief pause between requests print(f&#x27;\n=== PDF ACCESS RESULTS: {len(successful_pdfs)} SUCCESSFUL DOWNLOADS ===') "keyword">if successful_pdfs: "keyword">for pdf "keyword">in successful_pdfs: print(f&#x27;‚úì {pdf["title"]} - {pdf["size"]:,} bytes') print(f&#x27; File: {pdf["filename"]}') print(&#x27;\n=== EXTRACTING TEXT FROM DOWNLOADED PDFS ===') # Try to extract text "keyword">from each PDF "keyword">try: "keyword">from langchain_community.document_loaders "keyword">import PyPDFLoader all_pages = [] pdf_page_mapping = [] # Track which PDF each page comes "keyword">from "keyword">for pdf_info "keyword">in successful_pdfs: print(f&#x27;\nProcessing: {pdf_info["title"]}') "keyword">try: loader = PyPDFLoader(pdf_info[&#x27;filename']) pages = loader.load_and_split() print(f&#x27;‚úì Extracted {len(pages)} pages "keyword">from {pdf_info["title"]}') # Add pages to our collection "keyword">with source tracking start_page_num = len(all_pages) + 1 "keyword">for page "keyword">in pages: all_pages.append(page) pdf_page_mapping.append({ &#x27;pdf_title': pdf_info['title'], &#x27;pdf_filename': pdf_info['filename'], &#x27;page_in_collection': len(all_pages), &#x27;original_page_num': len(all_pages) - start_page_num + 1 }) # Show preview of first page "keyword">from this PDF "keyword">if pages: preview = pages[0].page_content[:200].replace(&#x27;\n', ' ') print(f&#x27; First page preview: {preview}...') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as pdf_error: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error processing {pdf_info["filename"]}: {str(pdf_error)}') print(f&#x27;\n*** TOTAL PAGES COLLECTED: {len(all_pages)} ***') "keyword">if len(all_pages) >= 11: print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING PAGE 11 FOR TARGET CONTENT ===') # Get page 11 (index 10) page_11 = all_pages[10] page_11_source = pdf_page_mapping[10] print(f&#x27;Page 11 source: {page_11_source["pdf_title"]}') print(f&#x27;Page 11 content length: {len(page_11.page_content):,} characters') # Save page 11 content "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/page_11_extracted.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;PAGE 11 CONTENT\n') f.write(f&#x27;Source: {page_11_source["pdf_title"]}\n') f.write(f&#x27;PDF File: {page_11_source["pdf_filename"]}\n') f.write(&#x27;='*80 + '\n\n') f.write(page_11.page_content) print(&#x27;‚úì Page 11 content saved to workspace/page_11_extracted.txt') # Analyze page 11 "keyword">for paragraphs page_11_text = page_11.page_content # Split into paragraphs (handle different paragraph separators) paragraphs = [] # Try different paragraph splitting methods "keyword">if &#x27;\n\n' "keyword">in page_11_text: paragraphs = [p.strip() "keyword">for p "keyword">in page_11_text.split(&#x27;\n\n') "keyword">if p.strip()] "keyword">elif &#x27;\n' "keyword">in page_11_text: # Split by single newlines "keyword">and group consecutive non-empty lines lines = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in page_11_text.split(&#x27;\n')] current_para = [] "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: "keyword">if line: current_para.append(line) "keyword">else: "keyword">if current_para: paragraphs.append(&#x27; '.join(current_para)) current_para = [] "keyword">if current_para: paragraphs.append(&#x27; '.join(current_para)) "keyword">else: # Fallback: treat entire content "keyword">as one paragraph paragraphs = [page_11_text.strip()] print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(paragraphs)} paragraphs on page 11') "keyword">if len(paragraphs) >= 2: second_to_last_para = paragraphs[-2] print(f&#x27;\n=== SECOND-TO-LAST PARAGRAPH ON PAGE 11 ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(second_to_last_para) print(&#x27;='*80) # Save the specific paragraph "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/page_11_second_to_last_paragraph.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(&#x27;SECOND-TO-LAST PARAGRAPH FROM PAGE 11\n') f.write(&#x27;='*50 + '\n\n') f.write(second_to_last_para) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Second-to-last paragraph saved to workspace/page_11_second_to_last_paragraph.txt') # Look "keyword">for endnote references "keyword">in this paragraph print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR ENDNOTE REFERENCES ===') endnote_patterns = [ r&#x27;\b(\d+)\b', # Simple numbers r&#x27;\[(\d+)\]', # Numbers "keyword">in brackets r&#x27;\((\d+)\)', # Numbers "keyword">in parentheses r&#x27;\b(\d+)\.', # Numbers "keyword">with periods r&#x27;see note (\d+)', # "see note X" format r&#x27;note (\d+)', # "note X" format r&#x27;footnote (\d+)', # "footnote X" format ] found_endnotes = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in endnote_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, second_to_last_para, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: "keyword">if match.isdigit() "keyword">and 1 <= int(match) <= 200: # Reasonable endnote range found_endnotes.append(int(match)) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and sort found_endnotes = sorted(list(set(found_endnotes))) "keyword">if found_endnotes: print(f&#x27;*** FOUND ENDNOTE REFERENCES: {found_endnotes} ***') # Now search "keyword">for the actual endnotes "keyword">in all collected pages print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING ALL PAGES FOR ENDNOTES SECTION ===') # Combine all pages to search "keyword">for endnotes full_text = &#x27;\n\n'.join([page.page_content "keyword">for page "keyword">in all_pages]) print(f&#x27;Total text to search: {len(full_text):,} characters') # Search "keyword">for Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS WITH NOVEMBER ACCESS DATE ===') # Comprehensive Wikipedia citation patterns wikipedia_patterns = [ r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]{0,200}november[^\n]{0,100}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,50}', r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\n]{0,200}november[^\n]{0,100}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,50}', r&#x27;accessed[^\n]{0,100}november[^\n]{0,50}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,100}wikipedia[^\n]{0,100}', r&#x27;november[^\n]{0,50}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,100}wikipedia[^\n]{0,200}', r&#x27;\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,20}november[^\n]{0,100}wikipedia[^\n]{0,200}', r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]{0,300}accessed[^\n]{0,100}november[^\n]{0,50}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,50}' ] wikipedia_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wikipedia_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: citation_text = match.group(0) # Extract the day "keyword">from November date day_patterns = [ r&#x27;november\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+november', r&#x27;november\s+(\d{1,2})(?:st|nd|rd|th)?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})(?:st|nd|rd|th)?\s+november' ] day_found = "keyword">None "keyword">for day_pattern "keyword">in day_patterns: day_match = re.search(day_pattern, citation_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if day_match: day_found = day_match.group(1) "keyword">break "keyword">if day_found: # Check "keyword">if this citation "keyword">is near any of our endnote numbers citation_context = full_text[max(0, match.start()-500):match.end()+500] related_endnotes = [] "keyword">for endnote_num "keyword">in found_endnotes: "keyword">if str(endnote_num) "keyword">in citation_context: related_endnotes.append(endnote_num) wikipedia_citations.append({ &#x27;citation': citation_text, &#x27;november_day': day_found, &#x27;position': match.start(), &#x27;context': citation_context, &#x27;related_endnotes': related_endnotes }) # Remove duplicates based on citation text unique_citations = [] seen_citations = set() "keyword">for citation "keyword">in wikipedia_citations: citation_key = citation[&#x27;citation'].strip().lower() "keyword">if citation_key "keyword">not "keyword">in seen_citations: seen_citations.add(citation_key) unique_citations.append(citation) "keyword">if unique_citations: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ FOUND {len(unique_citations)} UNIQUE WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS WITH NOVEMBER ACCESS DATES:') "keyword">for i, citation "keyword">in enumerate(unique_citations, 1): print(f&#x27;\nCitation {i}:') print(f&#x27;November day: {citation["november_day"]}') print(f&#x27;Position "keyword">in text: {citation["position"]:,}') "keyword">if citation[&#x27;related_endnotes']: print(f&#x27;Related endnotes: {citation["related_endnotes"]}') print(&#x27;Citation text:') print(&#x27;='*60) print(citation[&#x27;citation']) print(&#x27;='*60) # Show some context context_preview = citation[&#x27;context'][:300] + '...' "keyword">if len(citation['context']) > 300 "keyword">else citation['context'] print(f&#x27;Context: {context_preview}') print(&#x27;-'*60) # Save the analysis analysis_data = { &#x27;source_pdfs': [pdf['filename'] "keyword">for pdf "keyword">in successful_pdfs], &#x27;total_pages_analyzed': len(all_pages), &#x27;page_11_source': page_11_source, &#x27;page_11_paragraph_count': len(paragraphs), &#x27;second_to_last_paragraph': second_to_last_para, &#x27;endnote_references_found': found_endnotes, &#x27;wikipedia_citations': unique_citations, &#x27;extraction_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/wikipedia_endnote_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Complete analysis saved to workspace/wikipedia_endnote_analysis.json') # Determine the most likely answer "keyword">if len(unique_citations) == 1: answer_day = unique_citations[0][&#x27;november_day'] print(f&#x27;\n*** ANSWER FOUND: The Wikipedia article was accessed on November {answer_day} ***') "keyword">elif len(unique_citations) > 1: # Look "keyword">for citations most closely related to our endnote references best_citation = "keyword">None max_related_endnotes = 0 "keyword">for citation "keyword">in unique_citations: "keyword">if len(citation[&#x27;related_endnotes']) > max_related_endnotes: max_related_endnotes = len(citation[&#x27;related_endnotes']) best_citation = citation "keyword">if best_citation: answer_day = best_citation[&#x27;november_day'] print(f&#x27;\n*** MOST LIKELY ANSWER: November {answer_day} ***') print(f&#x27;(This citation "keyword">is related to endnotes: {best_citation["related_endnotes"]})') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n*** MULTIPLE CANDIDATES FOUND - Manual review needed ***') "keyword">for i, citation "keyword">in enumerate(unique_citations, 1): print(f&#x27;Option {i}: November {citation["november_day"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates found') # Broader search "keyword">for any Wikipedia references print(&#x27;\nSearching "keyword">for any Wikipedia references...') wiki_matches = re.finditer(r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]{0,100}', full_text, re.IGNORECASE) wiki_refs = [match.group(0) "keyword">for match "keyword">in wiki_matches] "keyword">if wiki_refs: print(f&#x27;Found {len(wiki_refs)} general Wikipedia references:') "keyword">for i, ref "keyword">in enumerate(wiki_refs[:5], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {ref}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No Wikipedia references found at all') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No endnote references found "keyword">in second-to-last paragraph') print(&#x27;Paragraph content "keyword">for manual inspection:') print(second_to_last_para) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† Page 11 has fewer than 2 paragraphs ({len(paragraphs)} found)') "keyword">if paragraphs: print(&#x27;Available paragraphs:') "keyword">for i, para "keyword">in enumerate(paragraphs, 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {para[:150]}...') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† Only {len(all_pages)} pages collected, page 11 "keyword">not available') print(&#x27;Available pages:') "keyword">for i, page "keyword">in enumerate(all_pages[:10], 1): source = pdf_page_mapping[i-1] preview = page.page_content[:100].replace(&#x27;\n', ' ') print(f&#x27;Page {i} ("keyword">from {source["pdf_title"]}): {preview}...') "keyword">except ImportError: print(&#x27;‚ùå PyPDFLoader "keyword">not available - cannot extract text "keyword">from PDFs') print(&#x27;PDFs have been downloaded but text extraction "keyword">is "keyword">not possible') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as extraction_error: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error during text extraction: {str(extraction_error)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No PDFs were successfully downloaded') print(&#x27;Cannot proceed "keyword">with page 11 analysis') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100) print(&#x27;ALTERNATIVE ACCESS ATTEMPT COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*100) print(&#x27;Summary:') print(f&#x27;- Attempted to access {len(pdf_links) "keyword">if "pdf_links" "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 0} PDF links') print(f&#x27;- Successfully downloaded {len(successful_pdfs)} PDFs') "keyword">if successful_pdfs: print(&#x27;- Extracted text "keyword">and analyzed "keyword">for page 11 content') print(&#x27;- Searched "keyword">for Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates') print(&#x27;\nObjective: Find exact day "keyword">in November when Wikipedia article was accessed')
üìÑ Output

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin "keyword">import time "keyword">import re print(&#x27;=== ALTERNATIVE ACCESS APPROACH: TRYING SPECIFIC CHAPTER PDF LINKS ===') print(&#x27;DOI: 10.2307/j.ctv9b2xdv') print(&#x27;Objective: Access individual chapter PDFs to locate page 11 "keyword">and Wikipedia endnote') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100 + '\n') # First, inspect the final bibliographic record to get chapter URLs final_record_path = &#x27;workspace/final_bibliographic_record.json' "keyword">if os.path.exists(final_record_path): print(&#x27;=== INSPECTING BIBLIOGRAPHIC RECORD FOR CHAPTER URLS ===') "keyword">with open(final_record_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: biblio_data = json.load(f) print(&#x27;Checking chapters_sections structure...') "keyword">if &#x27;chapters_sections' "keyword">in biblio_data: chapters = biblio_data[&#x27;chapters_sections'] print(f&#x27;Found {len(chapters)} chapters/sections') # Extract PDF links specifically pdf_links = [] "keyword">for i, chapter "keyword">in enumerate(chapters, 1): chapter_url = chapter.get(&#x27;url', '') chapter_title = chapter.get(&#x27;title', f'Chapter {i}') print(f&#x27;{i}. {chapter_title}') print(f&#x27; URL: {chapter_url}') "keyword">if &#x27;.pdf' "keyword">in chapter_url.lower(): pdf_links.append({ &#x27;title': chapter_title, &#x27;url': chapter_url, &#x27;index': i }) print(&#x27; *** PDF LINK DETECTED ***') print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(pdf_links)} direct PDF links:') "keyword">for pdf_link "keyword">in pdf_links: print(f&#x27;- {pdf_link["title"]} -> {pdf_link["url"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;Final bibliographic record "keyword">not found') exit() # Set up headers "keyword">for requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'application/pdf,text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', &#x27;Referer': 'https://www.jstor.org/' } # Try accessing each PDF link successful_pdfs = [] print(&#x27;\n=== ATTEMPTING TO ACCESS INDIVIDUAL CHAPTER PDFS ===') "keyword">for i, pdf_link "keyword">in enumerate(pdf_links, 1): print(f&#x27;\n{i}. Trying: {pdf_link["title"]}') print(f&#x27; URL: {pdf_link["url"]}') "keyword">try: response = requests.get(pdf_link[&#x27;url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) print(f&#x27; Status: {response.status_code}') print(f&#x27; Content-Type: {response.headers.get("content-type", "unknown")}') print(f&#x27; Content-Length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: content_type = response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;pdf' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or len(response.content) > 10000: # Likely PDF "keyword">if large print(&#x27; *** SUCCESS: PDF CONTENT RETRIEVED ***') # Save the PDF pdf_filename = f&#x27;workspace/chapter_{i}_{pdf_link["index"]}.pdf' "keyword">with open(pdf_filename, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as pdf_file: pdf_file.write(response.content) file_size = os.path.getsize(pdf_filename) print(f&#x27; ‚úì PDF saved to: {pdf_filename}') print(f&#x27; File size: {file_size:,} bytes ({file_size/1024/1024:.2f} MB)') successful_pdfs.append({ &#x27;title': pdf_link['title'], &#x27;filename': pdf_filename, &#x27;size': file_size, &#x27;original_url': pdf_link['url'] }) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ö† Content does "keyword">not appear to be PDF: {content_type}') # Save "keyword">as HTML "keyword">for inspection html_filename = f&#x27;workspace/chapter_{i}_response.html' "keyword">with open(html_filename, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as html_file: html_file.write(response.text) print(f&#x27; Saved response "keyword">as HTML: {html_filename}') "keyword">elif response.status_code == 403: print(&#x27; ‚ùå Access forbidden (403) - authentication may be required') "keyword">elif response.status_code == 404: print(&#x27; ‚ùå Not found (404) - URL may be invalid') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Request failed "keyword">with status {response.status_code}') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f&#x27; ‚ùå Error accessing PDF: {str(e)}') time.sleep(1) # Brief pause between requests print(f&#x27;\n=== PDF ACCESS RESULTS: {len(successful_pdfs)} SUCCESSFUL DOWNLOADS ===') "keyword">if successful_pdfs: "keyword">for pdf "keyword">in successful_pdfs: print(f&#x27;‚úì {pdf["title"]} - {pdf["size"]:,} bytes') print(f&#x27; File: {pdf["filename"]}') print(&#x27;\n=== EXTRACTING TEXT FROM DOWNLOADED PDFS ===') # Try to extract text "keyword">from each PDF "keyword">try: "keyword">from langchain_community.document_loaders "keyword">import PyPDFLoader all_pages = [] pdf_page_mapping = [] # Track which PDF each page comes "keyword">from "keyword">for pdf_info "keyword">in successful_pdfs: print(f&#x27;\nProcessing: {pdf_info["title"]}') "keyword">try: loader = PyPDFLoader(pdf_info[&#x27;filename']) pages = loader.load_and_split() print(f&#x27;‚úì Extracted {len(pages)} pages "keyword">from {pdf_info["title"]}') # Add pages to our collection "keyword">with source tracking start_page_num = len(all_pages) + 1 "keyword">for page "keyword">in pages: all_pages.append(page) pdf_page_mapping.append({ &#x27;pdf_title': pdf_info['title'], &#x27;pdf_filename': pdf_info['filename'], &#x27;page_in_collection': len(all_pages), &#x27;original_page_num': len(all_pages) - start_page_num + 1 }) # Show preview of first page "keyword">from this PDF "keyword">if pages: preview = pages[0].page_content[:200].replace(&#x27;\n', ' ') print(f&#x27; First page preview: {preview}...') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as pdf_error: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error processing {pdf_info["filename"]}: {str(pdf_error)}') print(f&#x27;\n*** TOTAL PAGES COLLECTED: {len(all_pages)} ***') "keyword">if len(all_pages) >= 11: print(&#x27;\n=== ANALYZING PAGE 11 FOR TARGET CONTENT ===') # Get page 11 (index 10) page_11 = all_pages[10] page_11_source = pdf_page_mapping[10] print(f&#x27;Page 11 source: {page_11_source["pdf_title"]}') print(f&#x27;Page 11 content length: {len(page_11.page_content):,} characters') # Save page 11 content "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/page_11_extracted.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f&#x27;PAGE 11 CONTENT\n') f.write(f&#x27;Source: {page_11_source["pdf_title"]}\n') f.write(f&#x27;PDF File: {page_11_source["pdf_filename"]}\n') f.write(&#x27;='*80 + '\n\n') f.write(page_11.page_content) print(&#x27;‚úì Page 11 content saved to workspace/page_11_extracted.txt') # Analyze page 11 "keyword">for paragraphs page_11_text = page_11.page_content # Split into paragraphs (handle different paragraph separators) paragraphs = [] # Try different paragraph splitting methods "keyword">if &#x27;\n\n' "keyword">in page_11_text: paragraphs = [p.strip() "keyword">for p "keyword">in page_11_text.split(&#x27;\n\n') "keyword">if p.strip()] "keyword">elif &#x27;\n' "keyword">in page_11_text: # Split by single newlines "keyword">and group consecutive non-empty lines lines = [line.strip() "keyword">for line "keyword">in page_11_text.split(&#x27;\n')] current_para = [] "keyword">for line "keyword">in lines: "keyword">if line: current_para.append(line) "keyword">else: "keyword">if current_para: paragraphs.append(&#x27; '.join(current_para)) current_para = [] "keyword">if current_para: paragraphs.append(&#x27; '.join(current_para)) "keyword">else: # Fallback: treat entire content "keyword">as one paragraph paragraphs = [page_11_text.strip()] print(f&#x27;\nFound {len(paragraphs)} paragraphs on page 11') "keyword">if len(paragraphs) >= 2: second_to_last_para = paragraphs[-2] print(f&#x27;\n=== SECOND-TO-LAST PARAGRAPH ON PAGE 11 ===') print(&#x27;='*80) print(second_to_last_para) print(&#x27;='*80) # Save the specific paragraph "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/page_11_second_to_last_paragraph.txt', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(&#x27;SECOND-TO-LAST PARAGRAPH FROM PAGE 11\n') f.write(&#x27;='*50 + '\n\n') f.write(second_to_last_para) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Second-to-last paragraph saved to workspace/page_11_second_to_last_paragraph.txt') # Look "keyword">for endnote references "keyword">in this paragraph print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR ENDNOTE REFERENCES ===') endnote_patterns = [ r&#x27;\b(\d+)\b', # Simple numbers r&#x27;\[(\d+)\]', # Numbers "keyword">in brackets r&#x27;\((\d+)\)', # Numbers "keyword">in parentheses r&#x27;\b(\d+)\.', # Numbers "keyword">with periods r&#x27;see note (\d+)', # "see note X" format r&#x27;note (\d+)', # "note X" format r&#x27;footnote (\d+)', # "footnote X" format ] found_endnotes = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in endnote_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, second_to_last_para, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if matches: "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: "keyword">if match.isdigit() "keyword">and 1 <= int(match) <= 200: # Reasonable endnote range found_endnotes.append(int(match)) # Remove duplicates "keyword">and sort found_endnotes = sorted(list(set(found_endnotes))) "keyword">if found_endnotes: print(f&#x27;*** FOUND ENDNOTE REFERENCES: {found_endnotes} ***') # Now search "keyword">for the actual endnotes "keyword">in all collected pages print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING ALL PAGES FOR ENDNOTES SECTION ===') # Combine all pages to search "keyword">for endnotes full_text = &#x27;\n\n'.join([page.page_content "keyword">for page "keyword">in all_pages]) print(f&#x27;Total text to search: {len(full_text):,} characters') # Search "keyword">for Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates print(&#x27;\n=== SEARCHING FOR WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS WITH NOVEMBER ACCESS DATE ===') # Comprehensive Wikipedia citation patterns wikipedia_patterns = [ r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]{0,200}november[^\n]{0,100}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,50}', r&#x27;en\.wikipedia\.org[^\n]{0,200}november[^\n]{0,100}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,50}', r&#x27;accessed[^\n]{0,100}november[^\n]{0,50}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,100}wikipedia[^\n]{0,100}', r&#x27;november[^\n]{0,50}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,100}wikipedia[^\n]{0,200}', r&#x27;\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,20}november[^\n]{0,100}wikipedia[^\n]{0,200}', r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]{0,300}accessed[^\n]{0,100}november[^\n]{0,50}\d{1,2}[^\n]{0,50}' ] wikipedia_citations = [] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in wikipedia_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, full_text, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: citation_text = match.group(0) # Extract the day "keyword">from November date day_patterns = [ r&#x27;november\s+(\d{1,2})', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})\s+november', r&#x27;november\s+(\d{1,2})(?:st|nd|rd|th)?', r&#x27;(\d{1,2})(?:st|nd|rd|th)?\s+november' ] day_found = "keyword">None "keyword">for day_pattern "keyword">in day_patterns: day_match = re.search(day_pattern, citation_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">if day_match: day_found = day_match.group(1) "keyword">break "keyword">if day_found: # Check "keyword">if this citation "keyword">is near any of our endnote numbers citation_context = full_text[max(0, match.start()-500):match.end()+500] related_endnotes = [] "keyword">for endnote_num "keyword">in found_endnotes: "keyword">if str(endnote_num) "keyword">in citation_context: related_endnotes.append(endnote_num) wikipedia_citations.append({ &#x27;citation': citation_text, &#x27;november_day': day_found, &#x27;position': match.start(), &#x27;context': citation_context, &#x27;related_endnotes': related_endnotes }) # Remove duplicates based on citation text unique_citations = [] seen_citations = set() "keyword">for citation "keyword">in wikipedia_citations: citation_key = citation[&#x27;citation'].strip().lower() "keyword">if citation_key "keyword">not "keyword">in seen_citations: seen_citations.add(citation_key) unique_citations.append(citation) "keyword">if unique_citations: print(f&#x27;\nüéØ FOUND {len(unique_citations)} UNIQUE WIKIPEDIA CITATIONS WITH NOVEMBER ACCESS DATES:') "keyword">for i, citation "keyword">in enumerate(unique_citations, 1): print(f&#x27;\nCitation {i}:') print(f&#x27;November day: {citation["november_day"]}') print(f&#x27;Position "keyword">in text: {citation["position"]:,}') "keyword">if citation[&#x27;related_endnotes']: print(f&#x27;Related endnotes: {citation["related_endnotes"]}') print(&#x27;Citation text:') print(&#x27;='*60) print(citation[&#x27;citation']) print(&#x27;='*60) # Show some context context_preview = citation[&#x27;context'][:300] + '...' "keyword">if len(citation['context']) > 300 "keyword">else citation['context'] print(f&#x27;Context: {context_preview}') print(&#x27;-'*60) # Save the analysis analysis_data = { &#x27;source_pdfs': [pdf['filename'] "keyword">for pdf "keyword">in successful_pdfs], &#x27;total_pages_analyzed': len(all_pages), &#x27;page_11_source': page_11_source, &#x27;page_11_paragraph_count': len(paragraphs), &#x27;second_to_last_paragraph': second_to_last_para, &#x27;endnote_references_found': found_endnotes, &#x27;wikipedia_citations': unique_citations, &#x27;extraction_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } "keyword">with open(&#x27;workspace/wikipedia_endnote_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(&#x27;\n‚úì Complete analysis saved to workspace/wikipedia_endnote_analysis.json') # Determine the most likely answer "keyword">if len(unique_citations) == 1: answer_day = unique_citations[0][&#x27;november_day'] print(f&#x27;\n*** ANSWER FOUND: The Wikipedia article was accessed on November {answer_day} ***') "keyword">elif len(unique_citations) > 1: # Look "keyword">for citations most closely related to our endnote references best_citation = "keyword">None max_related_endnotes = 0 "keyword">for citation "keyword">in unique_citations: "keyword">if len(citation[&#x27;related_endnotes']) > max_related_endnotes: max_related_endnotes = len(citation[&#x27;related_endnotes']) best_citation = citation "keyword">if best_citation: answer_day = best_citation[&#x27;november_day'] print(f&#x27;\n*** MOST LIKELY ANSWER: November {answer_day} ***') print(f&#x27;(This citation "keyword">is related to endnotes: {best_citation["related_endnotes"]})') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n*** MULTIPLE CANDIDATES FOUND - Manual review needed ***') "keyword">for i, citation "keyword">in enumerate(unique_citations, 1): print(f&#x27;Option {i}: November {citation["november_day"]}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates found') # Broader search "keyword">for any Wikipedia references print(&#x27;\nSearching "keyword">for any Wikipedia references...') wiki_matches = re.finditer(r&#x27;wikipedia[^\n]{0,100}', full_text, re.IGNORECASE) wiki_refs = [match.group(0) "keyword">for match "keyword">in wiki_matches] "keyword">if wiki_refs: print(f&#x27;Found {len(wiki_refs)} general Wikipedia references:') "keyword">for i, ref "keyword">in enumerate(wiki_refs[:5], 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {ref}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;No Wikipedia references found at all') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ö† No endnote references found "keyword">in second-to-last paragraph') print(&#x27;Paragraph content "keyword">for manual inspection:') print(second_to_last_para) "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† Page 11 has fewer than 2 paragraphs ({len(paragraphs)} found)') "keyword">if paragraphs: print(&#x27;Available paragraphs:') "keyword">for i, para "keyword">in enumerate(paragraphs, 1): print(f&#x27;{i}. {para[:150]}...') "keyword">else: print(f&#x27;\n‚ö† Only {len(all_pages)} pages collected, page 11 "keyword">not available') print(&#x27;Available pages:') "keyword">for i, page "keyword">in enumerate(all_pages[:10], 1): source = pdf_page_mapping[i-1] preview = page.page_content[:100].replace(&#x27;\n', ' ') print(f&#x27;Page {i} ("keyword">from {source["pdf_title"]}): {preview}...') "keyword">except ImportError: print(&#x27;‚ùå PyPDFLoader "keyword">not available - cannot extract text "keyword">from PDFs') print(&#x27;PDFs have been downloaded but text extraction "keyword">is "keyword">not possible') "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as extraction_error: print(f&#x27;‚ùå Error during text extraction: {str(extraction_error)}') "keyword">else: print(&#x27;\n‚ùå No PDFs were successfully downloaded') print(&#x27;Cannot proceed "keyword">with page 11 analysis') print(&#x27;\n' + '='*100) print(&#x27;ALTERNATIVE ACCESS ATTEMPT COMPLETE') print(&#x27;='*100) print(&#x27;Summary:') print(f&#x27;- Attempted to access {len(pdf_links) "keyword">if "pdf_links" "keyword">in locals() "keyword">else 0} PDF links') print(f&#x27;- Successfully downloaded {len(successful_pdfs)} PDFs') "keyword">if successful_pdfs: print(&#x27;- Extracted text "keyword">and analyzed "keyword">for page 11 content') print(&#x27;- Searched "keyword">for Wikipedia citations "keyword">with November access dates') print(&#x27;\nObjective: Find exact day "keyword">in November when Wikipedia article was accessed')

Status: {response.status_code}') "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f&#x27; ‚úì SUCCESS - UCL Press page accessible') print(f&#x27; Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') # Save the page "keyword">for analysis "keyword">with open(f&#x27;workspace/ucl_press_page_{i}.html', 'w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) # Look "keyword">for download links soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Search "keyword">for PDF download links pdf_links = [] download_selectors = [ &#x27;a[href*=".pdf"]', &#x27;a[href*="download"]', &#x27;a[href*="full-text"]', &#x27;a[href*="open-access"]', &#x27;.download-link a', &#x27;.pdf-link a', &#x27;.open-access a' ] "keyword">for selector "keyword">in download_selectors: links = soup.select(selector) "keyword">for link "keyword">in links: href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if href: "keyword">if href.startswith(&#x27;/'): href = urljoin(url, href) text = link.get_text().strip() pdf_links.append({&#x27;url': href, 'text': text}) "keyword">if pdf_links: print(f&#x27; "keyword">with open(crossref_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: crossref_data = json.load(f) "keyword">if &#x27;message' "keyword">in crossref_data: work = crossref_data[&#x27;message'] # Look "keyword">for additional URLs "keyword">or links potential_url_fields = [&#x27;URL', 'link', 'resource', 'relation'] "keyword">for field "keyword">in potential_url_fields: "keyword">if field "keyword">in work: print(f&#x27;\nFound {field} field:') field_data = work[field] "keyword">if isinstance(field_data, str): print(f&#x27; tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 02:22:13

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and successfully discovered a direct PDF download link from UCL Press. The code found that UCL Press provides open access to this publication with a direct PDF link: 'http://discovery.ucl.ac.uk/10080589/1/The-Responsibility-of-Intellectuals.pdf'. This is a significant breakthrough as it bypasses JSTOR's authentication requirements.
